summary: Midtown East's Copinette serves American cuisine with strong French influences.
It might be a little tricky to find Freeman's but if you can make your way there, you’ll find surreal, hunting lodge–inspired decor, a hip scene and the most comforting meals.
ABC Kitchen by Michelin starred Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten has a passionate commitment to offering the freshest organic and local ingredients possible.
Michael Bao Huynh, of Bia Garden and Baoguette fame, brings his formula—Pan-Asian food in a sleek setting—to the east side.
Mexican celebrity chef Enrique Olvera opened an all-day eatery in Noho.
Located in the historic Essex Street Market Building, Essex is a loft-like multilevel space with contemporary cuisine inspired by the flavors of the Lower East Side.
Socarrat is the sensuous crust that forms on the bottom of the paella pan when the liquid is rendered and the rice reaches its peak of succulence.
This new restaurant from chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten perfectly blends culinary excellence with architectural marvel and sustainability practices.
Isabelle’s Italian menu adds unusual touches to traditional appetizers and entrees.
Mission Ceviche, from chef Jose Luis Chavez and partner Brice Mastroluca, has become synonymous with modern Peruvian cuisine, offering a diverse array of dishes crafted from the freshest ingredients.
A lavishly gorgeous and perfectly refined town house is home to one of Jean-Georges Vongerichten's greatest dining accomplishments.
Domodomo is a premier Japanese restaurant specializing in handrolls, sushi, and modern interpretations of traditional Asian dishes.
Many are willing to travel far for food this good.
Daniel Boulud's tribute to the original Café Boulud in Lyon, France, serves finely executed cuisine.
The famous lobster rolls at this Red Hook mainstay aren't all you'll find on the menu, but their popularity is a sure sign you should sample one.
This Park Slope spot whips up inventive, beautifully plated cuisine leaning heavily on traditional South American flavors.
David Chang’s original Korean-American sensation.
Malii Gramercy is a creative Thai restaurant in the Gramercy Park area in Manhattan.
Koloman bridges two worlds: turn-of-the-century European cafe culture and the energy of today’s New York.
Influenced by the rich and exotic culture of the Caribbean, Kokomo's cuisine builds on familiar island ingredients and offerings with a modern flair.
This chic 88-seat, David Rockwell-designed restaurant serves contemporary cuisine with British sensibilities.
T. Brasserie serves timeless French fare using only the finest and freshest ingredients from breakfast through dinner.
This sumptuously-appointed, dimly-lit piano-bar-meets-supper-club evokes the feeling of stumbling into a local legend’s living room during a night out in NYC—but is also an ode to Broadway.
The Frenchman’s Dough is a traditional Italian restaurant with a French twist, serving freshly made pastas and perfectly charred pizzas.
Carne Mare is an Italian chophouse by chef Andrew Carmellini offering prime cuts of steaks, fine seafood and Italian specialties.
Mito's esteemed head chef, who has devoted numerous years to the masterful art of cooking, brings with him a wealth of experience at esteemed establishments such as Jean Georges and Buddha Bar.
At La Barra, you can explore beloved dishes from numerous tapas bars all around Spain.
Xolo serves contemporary Mexican cuisine with a dash of tradition for good measure in a casual and fun space near the Williamsburg Bridge.
This cavernous restaurant captures the richness of NYC with a big, inclusive menu that ranges from miso to matzo ball soup and Cobb salad.
This elegant Thai restaurant in NoMad offers popular dishes such as pad Thai and tom yum goong, as well as chef's specialties that show the complexity of the country's cuisine.
Le Rock is a bustling French Brasserie that serves traditional French fare alongside some more unexpected offerings.
Gui Steakhouse is elevated steakhouse experience that integrates the unique flavors and techniques of Korean beef grilling.
Founded in 1959 by a couple who relocated from England, London Lennie's has evolved into a premier seafood restaurant, now owned by their son.
Feast on stunning views of the City and a compelling New American menu.
Lé Chai, located in Flatlands, Brooklyn, redefines the classic steakhouse experience with a Thai fusion twist.
Benny John's Bar and Grill is a steakhouse that offers lunch and dinner daily, along with happy hour and bar bites.

shortTitle: Del Friscos Double Eagle Steakhouse New York
summary: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse New York is an energetic, sprawling, three-story restaurant in Midtown, featuring floor-to-ceiling windows that offer grand views of Sixth Avenue.
The Wolfe is a sports bar and restaurant inspired by Tom Wolfe, the late novelist and long-time NYC resident.
Enjoy artwork alongside delicious culinary creations and original cocktails at The Gallery, a new cultural space in the Flatiron District from chef Hiroki Odo.

Chef Mary Attea leads a culinary team that draws on their heritages, world travels and personal inclinations to create vivid flavors and inventive dishes that deftly cross borders and defy categorization.
The menu at La Sirène is crafted to reflect the best of South France and the freshest ingredients of the season.
Blackbarn is an American restaurant serving local, artisanal food in the comfort of a modern barn setting.
The elegantly modern and sophisticated Altesi Ristorante, on the Upper East Side, offers a menu consisting of Tuscan-inspired dishes.
Keuka Kafe is a New American restaurant and wine bar in Forest Hills, Queens, that serves seafood, gourmet cheese, dessert and more with a full menu of wine, beer and mixed drinks.
Draught 55, founded by Katrina McNamee in 2012, provides an exceptional, seasonally curated food menu and a carefully curated beer and cocktail selection.
Naks by Unapologetic Foods offers a gastronomic tour of the Philippines framed by the personal memories of the restaurant’s chef, Eric Valdez.
Sinigual celebrates a fusion of contemporary and native flavors of Mexico.

Nestled in the park, right on the lake, is the Central Park Boathouse, an iconic and elegant restaurant with both indoor and outdoor seating, and different menus (in different price ranges) for each seating area.
Lore is a seasonal restaurant located in the South Slope neighborhood in Brooklyn.
Aromi is a restaurant and pizzeria with a mission to bring classic, authentic Italian recipes to Carroll Gardens in Brooklyn.
This modern European restaurant offers an impeccable integration between fine dining and fine art.
Chazz Palminteri's features the finest meat, seafood and pasta dishes, as well as antipasto and traditional Italian desserts.

shortTitle: Park Ave Kitchen by David Burke
summary: Park Ave Kitchen by David Burke brings together delicious and authentic American fare with top-notch service in a fun atmosphere.
The beloved Japanese restaurant Momoya has added this new incarnation on Manhattan's Upper West Side.
Shan features authentic Szechuan food and a casual bar in a comfortably stylish space in Boerum Hill.
Rosevale Cocktail Room,  located inside the Civilian Hotel, offers a world-class beverage experience alongside delectable bites.
Anassa ("breath of fresh air" in Greek) is an elegant interpretation of the traditional Greek taverna.
Tom Colicchio serves a menu of quintessential New York City dishes in Lower Manhattan.
This casual Italian restaurant offers a full variety of reasonably priced sandwiches, pastas, pizza, chicken, veal and fresh fish dishes.
Find creative fine dining in a stunning art deco tower.
El Coco is a new taqueria in Hell's Kitchen with a twist, featuring authentic Mexican dishes, empanadas, traditional tacos, and a variety of signature sauces.
The Quimby is named after the United State's first licensed female pilot, Harriet Quimby, a pioneer in aviation, known for her style and adventurous spirit.
La Contenta Oeste offers a traditional Mexican menu with French accents and also features one of NYC's largest tequila, mezcal and alt agave selections.
Owned by the same family for more than a century, Barbetta is a romantic Italian restaurant with ornate décor and a lush back garden.
Nonna Dora's is an Italian restaurant and pasta bar in Kips Bay serving fresh pasta made daily by Nonna herself.
Twilight Lounge is a modern Chinese kitchen in the East Village where chef Peizheng Chen reimagines Cantonese and Sichuan cuisine.
Junoon's name, meaning "passion" or "obsession," is an indication of the dedication that went into this restaurant.
Schilling offers a day-to-night bistro that features Michelin-starred chef Eduard Frauneder's contemporary take on Austrian fare.
A seasonally-driven menu with Italian and French influences is complemented by a carefully curated wine list to provide "Palate Character."
This Boerum Hill Italian restaurant is Stefano Barbagallo and Adriana Luque's second, following their Seaport location that opened in 2013.
Le Pavillon expresses chef Daniel Boulud’s roots in New York City with a fresh and unique approach to fine dining in a dramatic setting.

The Dolar Shop's philosophy is to continuously innovate, always serve fresh ingredients, and to excel in customer service to build a strong connection with their guests, and proudly showcase the Macau hot pot culture.

Upper West Siders have flocked to this popular French cafe for years for a taste of their bistro favorites, like croque monsieur, steak frites, French onion soup, duck confit and burgers, as well as a full brunch menu.
American Cut Steakhouse pays homage to the best original and aspirational New York dining experience, the steakhouse.
Family-owned since 1974, Maggie's Place serves up shepherd's pie, chicken pot pie, fish & chips, burgers and pub fare alongside a selection of wine and beer.
Omar Daoud, executive chef at Balade, is a culinary virtuoso in Middle Eastern cuisine, with a particular expertise in Lebanese dishes.
Set in a romantic and welcoming Restaurant Row townhouse, Lattanzi is celebrated for its "Roman Jewish-style specialties.
Lorenzos Restaurant, Bar & Cabaret serves modern Italian and American fare at breakfast, lunch, and dinner daily.
A classy, well-rated Italian eatery decorated in beige and burgundy in the neighborhood of Gramercy, Giorgio's offerings include salad, pasta, sandwiches and entrees such as filet mignon.
Having perfected the classic steakhouse, the Benjamin Steakhouse Restaurant Group has moved beyond beef to conquer the seafood market.
Renowned the world over for its steak frites, Le Relais de Venise L’Entrecôte’s signature dish is prepared using a famous Parisian secret sauce, as well as sinful French desserts.
Carnivores and sophisticates meet at this all-American steakhouse, opened in 2006 by star chef Michael Lomonaco.
Seasonal Italian classics and fantastic Amalfi style pizza paired with a cocktail-forward beverage program make Uva Next Door the playful little sister to the original Uva.
Nami Nori is a cozy Williamsburg spot to try the innovative temaki hand rolls—a sort of Japanese version of tacos.
Gyu-Kaku Japanese BBQ - Amsterdam specializes in yakiniku—barbecue meat over a charcoal grill.
At Casa Lever, Modern art and timeless architecture set the stage for Italian classics, curated wines and supreme hospitality.
Lincoln Ristorante combines Chef Shea Gallante’s refined interpretation of Italian cuisine with the vision of restaurateur Nick Valenti.
Simply put, STK is not your daddy's steakhouse.
Treadwell Park’s craft beer hall offers 20 rotating draft beers and ciders, as well as beer in some of the cocktails and ice cream floats.
Italian wines and flavors from Tuscany are served in a modern space infused with traditional elements on the Upper East Side.
This all-day modern Italian spot draws inspiration from Italy's Marche region, offering a menu that highlights premium ingredients and house-made pastas.

Boucherie West Village is a traditional French brasserie and steakhouse, celebrating Joie de Vivre, that prepares a menu of French classics and timeless bistro favorites, in addition to dry-aged steaks.
Michael's has long functioned as a power-breakfast-and-lunch scene for the who's who of media.
Executive chef Ari Bokovza's menu is inspired by Levantine traditions, brought to life through innovative preparation.
STK Rooftop overlooks the beautiful High Line, right in the middle of the Meatpacking District.
Celebrating the beauty of simplicity, chef Hillary Sterling centers Ci Siamo's Italian-inflected menu around live-fire cooking and seasonal ingredients.
Founded in late 2023 by chef Johan Halsberghe, known for his chocolate mousse, this bistro serves Belgian classic dishes and also chef's creations.
Bocca Di Bacco—Hell's Kitchen, an Italian restaurant located near Columbus Circle and Central Park, is a favorite spot for celebrities, tourists and native New Yorkers alike.
The Independent is a snug and stylish space for notable drinks and food in Times Square, not far from Broadway theaters, the Garment District and Bryant Park.
Baci & Abbracci offers traditional Neapolitan fare as well as Italian classics from all over the "Boot."
The East Village is home to a luxurious sushi experience in a narrow space curved like a knife blade.
The first Stout NYC location is comprised of 3-stories, over 16,000 square feet of space and multiple private party rooms.
With an exciting and approachable menu featuring classics with a twist, Little Maven is a vibrant, fun and delicious choice.
Inspired by the warmth and comfort of the Italian countryside, Olio e Più and chef Danilo Galati bring tradition and authentic Italian cuisine to the West Village.
El Coco is a new taqueria in Chelsea with a twist, featuring authentic Mexican dishes, empanadas, traditional tacos, and a variety of signature sauces.
The Shell is a modern seafood restaurant on Manhattan's Upper West Side that features a vibrant and sophisticated atmosphere.

This neighborhood Italian restaurant features handcrafted pastries every morning, grilled panini on homemade focaccia and salads at lunch, and fresh pastas and locally and seasonally inspired Italian plates at night.
La Marchande is chef John Fraser’s modernized take on the French brasserie, set in The Wall Street Hotel.
With specialty coffee, breakfast sandwiches, brick-oven pizza and craft cocktails on offer, The Uptown Garrison has something to satisfy your cravings from morning till night.
State Grill and Bar, an elegant addition to the newly renovated Empire State Building, is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
Fire-roasted, grandma-inspired Italian food in Williamsburg.
Pristine Mediterranean-style seafood shines in an industrial-chic Midtown setting at Milos.
Sarabeth's Park Avenue South offers contemporary American cuisine in an elegant yet modern atmosphere.

shortTitle: RA Sushi Bar Restaurant – Times Square
summary: RA Sushi serves up a fresh, creative, Japanese menu with a unique blend of creative sushi and an innovative menu from the kitchen.
Rosa Mexicano serves up Mexican goodness in an authentic yet stylish and festive atmosphere.
Jade Eatery & Lounge serves favorite Pan-Asian and southeast Asian dishes, as well as creative culinary innovations that have become neighborhood favorites.
You’ll find all the signature Stout NYC favorites here on the corner of John and Gold Streets in the Financial District.
Kraam, a restaurant in NoMad, serves up authentic Thai cuisine with playful culinary twists.
This modern, spacious American restaurant also has a great cocktail list.
This modern Italian trattoria and bar on Macy's sixth floor boasts soaring ceilings and beautiful natural light, not to mention impressive views of the Empire State Building.

shortTitle: The Dining Room at Gramercy Tavern
summary: Executive chef and partner Michael Anthony’s menu consists of elegant dishes with a rustic influence that showcases the restaurant’s relationships with local farms and purveyors.
You don't have to go all the way to Italy for authentic Tuscan cuisine—just as far as Spring Street.
The Leopard at des Artistes has recaptured the splendor of the old Café des Artistes, which was at its height from 1975 to 2009, when it was owned by the legendary George Lang.
Combines an authentic ostentatious decor and mellow ambiance, representing one of the last great Victorian "gin palaces" that once flourished in the industrial cities of Northern Ireland and England.
Bobo serves classic French food, seasonal cocktails and sustainably produced wines from family-owned vineyards.
Osteria 57 offers a different kind of Italian menu, combining seafood choices and vegetarian dishes.
Visit this Park Slope restaurant for an unforgettable dining experience, with homemade udon noodles crafted from the finest ingredients and complemented by a selection of Japanese sakes and beers.
La Gioconda focuses on typical regional Italian cuisine using the finest ingredients
Pristine Mediterranean-style seafood shines in an industrial-chic setting at Milos, featuring a view of the Vessel and Hudson River.

After a hundred years in Little Italy, Grotto Azzurra is holding down its history as host to Caruso and Sinatra; that same hospitality extends to the travelers and locals who pack the recently renovated restaurant.
This Italian café restaurant has good energy, with an enthusiastic staff and executive chef Cruz Goler in the open kitchen.
Chef/owner Didier Pawlicki's menu at La Sirène is crafted to reflect the best of South France and the freshest ingredients of the season.
Zuma, the brainchild of award-winning co-founder and creator Rainer Becker, brings its internationally acclaimed style of modern Japanese cuisine to Midtown Manhattan.
Noreetuh is a modern Hawaiian restaurant in the East Village from chef Chung Chow.
Suprema, home of the top-rated burger in NYC, was inspired by the great salumerias of Rome, tapas bars of Barcelona and sidewalk cafés of Paris.

This restaurant-bakery combines rustic Italian and European cooking and traditional Jewish food. Alongside fresh homemade pastas, entrée salads and Belgian fries, there's Jewish deli rye and hand-rolled bagels and bialys.
Chef Jose Luis Flores oversees a kitchen that specializes in mole poblano alongside other regional Mexican dishes.
Dowling’s at The Carlyle's menu features chef Moosah Reaume’s interpretations of timeless New York favorites and throwback dishes from another era, with an emphasis on tableside preparations.
Hunt & Fish Club NYC debuted in Midtown Manhattan in 2014 with a classic yet contemporary menu of exceptionally prepared steaks and game plus a unique selection of canapés and seafood offerings.
Simon Oren, Dudi Sasson and chef James Tracey bring midtown Manhattan a glamorous bold American restaurant: Monterey.
Taste of India offers a sophisticated fine dining experience with effortlessly charming staff and discreet service.
This chic restaurant and cocktail bar serves uncomplicated food and cocktails in warm, stylish surroundings that invite conversation and sharing.
Mae Mae Cafe & Plant Shop is a plant-based cafe and bar in Mott Haven that is also a plant shop.
Marlow Bistro combines its Mediterranean roots with a European sensibility, and strives to create a warm and welcoming space.
Throw back a mojito in the dimly lit bar and savor authentic and affordable Latin American cuisine.
Gran Morsi, named after the Italian word for "bites" epitomizes elegant simplicity.
Nangman BBQ is a Korean barbecue restaurant created to celebrate the spirit of glamping.
At Palo Santo, you’ll find chef Jacques Gautier’s pan-Latin cooking in a Brooklyn brownstone.
Fandi Mata delivers a new take on artisinal, global cuisine inspired by the vast Mediterranean region, featuring classics with a contemporary touch.
Good barbeque is surprisingly hard to find in New York, but Virgil's was among the first to boldly promise the real deal.
Through its festive ambiance, vibrant décor and mouth-watering food, dining at Havana Central is like taking a mini vacation.
Ben and Jack Sinanaj, long-time waiters at Peter Luger’s, have opened a classic steakhouse all their own.
Find a restaurant, market, salumeria and bakery all in one spot.
Francie is a New American brasserie serving a menu inspired by French and Italian flavors.
Bar Sprezzatura NYC is a coastal-inspired rooftop aperitivo bar and restaurant located atop the Kimpton Theta New York - Times Square hotel.
Fleur is Brooklyn's culinary gem where Shanghai cuisine meets vibrant tapas and crafted cocktails.
Midtown East holds a luxurious Northern Chinese restaurant and lounge.
This lively, modern Japanese restaurant serves free-spirited izakaya dishes invigorated with New York attitude.
Felice, the ultimate Tuscan restaurant and wine bar, already in two locations on the Upper East Side in NYC, is also in the Financial District.
Fogo de Chão is an authentic Brazilian steakhouse (churrascaria) that has been setting the standard in Brazil since 1979.
Bar Primi is a casual Italian pasta shop devoted to "primi piatti," the pasta course.
The beloved West Village institution comes to Midtown with another sun-filled dining room, large sidewalk cafe, beautiful private dining room, spacious bar and wine bar.
French Louie is a modern French-American bistro from the team behind Buttermilk Channel.
With a name like Oceans, it’s no surprise to learn that this restaurant’s menu is inspired by fresh catches from the Atlantic, Pacific and Mediterranean.
There were high expectations for this Midtown French bistro even before the doors opened, as it was the latest in the restaurant family of Alain Ducasse, arguably the top French chef in the world.
Through the Art Deco lobby of the historic Evelyn Hotel, find The Tusk Bar for bright takes on classic cocktails, raw bar and seafood-driven small plates.
Le Gratin echoes the traditional bistros and bouchons of chef Daniel Boulud's hometown of Lyon, France, known for their welcoming ambiance and soulful cuisine.
Sagaponack is a seafood restaurant specializing in chef-driven approachable quality.
It all started in a Greek revival townhouse on the edge of the Meatpacking District, where LDV Hospitality brought an unexpected and soulful touch to Italian cuisine.
This enormous, bi-level, Italian-ish venue offers a huge variety of meals and dishes.
Loring Place offers seasonal, local, American cuisine by Chef Dan Kluger in the heart of Greenwich Village.
When in Bangkok is a Thai restaurant that will transport you to a kitchen in Bangkok.
Lafayette, a French restaurant in downtown Manhattan's NoHo neighborhood, is at once a gorgeous dining destination, vibrant nightspot and delectable French bakery.
For more than three decades, Fresco by Scotto, a family-run venture, has been a go-to destination for celebrities, CEOs, and New Yorkers in the know.
Simply put, STK is not your daddy's steakhouse.
Located on 34th Street in the historic Murray Hill district of Manhattan, Villa Berulia offers a bucolic retreat from the hectic area around the Empire State Building only four blocks away.
The team at Marsanne are passionate about sharing the rich and diverse flavors of Mediterranean cuisine with the community.
The Parlour Room Bar and Grill is a classic American restaurant nestled near Herald Square that also features a collection of 450 of the world’s finest whiskeys.
Under the direction of executive chef/culinary director Vincenzo Garofalo, the farm-to-table restaurant's seasonally inspired menus skew toward what's fresh and fun.
Enjoy the world's first LEED-certified bowling alley and music venue.

Inspired by Southern Italy, Leuca is a neighborhood restaurant from Chef Andrew Carmellini's NoHo Hospitality Group serving house-made pastas, wood-fired pizzas and rustic dishes in a sunlit corner space in Williamsburg.
Alex Stupak’s Midtown flagship is a warm and inviting venue with an extensive agave program and inventive menu.
This clubby spot serves steakhouse classics and Asian dishes in Times Square.
Konban is a contemporary Japanese restaurant offering an exquisite dining experience with a focus on katsu, housemade udon like mazemen, and other creative izakaya dishes.
Maison Pickle offers Continental classics and that iconic American sandwich, the French Dip, in a refined and relaxed setting for food and drink.
Smoky brisket, pulled pork and St. Louis–style ribs taste authentic and won't set you back too much.
This Victorian-themed bar features a cocktail list that reflects both the Victorian and Prohibition eras.
Experience Italian classics with a twist at Altamirano's, family owned and operated by former Upper East Side waiters living their dream.
Masseria East continues the fine dining legacy of the old Parma Restaurant, which was established in this location in 1977.
This neighborhood trattoria has been a reliable Upper West Side standby for a number of years.
Masatoshi “Gari” Sugio is the Japanese owner-chef of several highly regarded sushi spots known for procuring the freshest fish on the market.
Ánimo! is an authentic Mexican restaurant dedicated to honoring the rich culinary traditions of Mexico.
The Chemistry Room is an innovative and modern take on traditional Japanese cuisine that combines tradition with unforgettable modern flair.

Bananas is an expression of the chef-owners' take on Asian American food, incorporating classic Asian flavors with Western cuisine—a signature menu of American favorites with elements of Asian cooking.
Marcus Samuelsson's restaurant focuses on elevated American comfort food.
This culinary haven in SoHo embraces the unique character of the surrounding neighborhood.
There's almost always a party at the Greenhouse Café, a popular Bay Ridge venue where many local Brooklynites celebrate their weddings, anniversaries and other special events.
Chef Dan Kluger offers a seasonally-driven, vegetable-forward dining experience that creatively highlights seasonal ingredients and rotisserie cooking.
Chef-owner Bolivar Perez has decades of experience cooking Italian fine cuisine.
Located on Restaurant Row in Manhattan's Theatre District, Sicily Osteria is a dining destination that appeals to local residents and office workers, as well as Broadway theatergoers.
Victor’s, in the Theatre District, has been a redoubt for high-end Cuban food for decades.
Pete's Tavern is the oldest continuously operating bar and restaurant in New York City.
Avtar Walia, owner of Tamarind in the Flatiron District, has opened Tamarind TriBeCa in a handsome art deco building at the corner of Hudson and Franklin Streets.

shortTitle: The Bar Room at The Modern
summary: The lively Bar Room at The Modern, a Michelin-starred contemporary American restaurant at MoMA, offers Chef Abram Bissell's vividly seasonal contemporary cooking à la carte.
Heritage Grand Bakery, inspired by the Mediterranean, serves signature breads, pastries and wood-fired pizzas in a stylish and worldly setting.
Indian Table showcases the flavors, herbs, spices and cooking techniques of Goa, the coastal Indian state once colonized by the Portuguese, with a distinct British influence.
Darbar Grill, conveniently located in the heart of East Midtown, serves up solid, fresh Indian cuisine.
A favorite of concert goers at nearby Carnegie Hall, Trattoria Dell'Arte is a design landmark, thanks to an interior done by the legendary Milton Glaser, and a entrance marked by a giant white nose.
With a focus on fresh, high-quality ingredients and artfully crafted dishes, Gaia offers a dining experience that blends elegance and flavor in a vibrant, modern atmosphere.
Maizal Restaurant is a family-owned restaurant featuring authentic Mexican cuisine from Puebla.
Bixi offers dishes and drinks that are packed with unforgettable flavors and served by a knowledgeable, friendly staff.
The Stand was recently voted New York's "Best Comedy Club" by New York magazine and regularly hosts top comedians like Judah Friedlander, Todd Barry, Janeane Garofalo and more.
Hav & Mar is a vibrant seafood house in Chelsea from chef Marcus Samuelsson.
This highly-regarded steakhouse in Astoria serves prime cuts of meat aged to perfection in a unique way, accompanied by superior customer service.
Hidden inside Walker Hotel is Society Cafe, a market-to-table American restaurant by chef Nicholas McCann.
5 Napkin Burger serves up hearty and delightful fare, including their signature burger.

Located near Radio City and Times Square, Del Frisco's Grille features a sweeping bar with a wood-burning oven, expansive walls showcasing more than 700 bottles of wine and a sprawling patio perfect for al fresco dining.
Jazba is a tribute and celebration of India's famous eateries—their take on some of the iconic dishes which are more than a century old.
Located in Midtown Manhattan near the Theatre District, Kellari features traditional Greek cuisine, as well as the largest selection of Greek wines in any restaurant in the United States.
Fast, cheap and friendly, Souvlaki GR exudes the same spirit as its food truck, which began the enterprise.
Kubeh, a Greenwich Village restaurant dedicated to lesser known cuisines of the Middle East, is the product of chef Melanie Shurka and husband David Ort.
The Ivy Room is a modern, swanky take on the NYC piano and cocktail lounge.
Chef/owner Adam Schop brings classic French fare, in an environment familiar to popular bistros found on the side streets of Paris, to Hell’s Kitchen.
With a menu crafted from the freshest ingredients and a warm, inviting atmosphere, Āne Bar & Restaurant aims to make every meal a celebration.
Mexican inspired rather than straightforward Mexican describes the innovative, vibrant dishes at Enrique Olvera's Cosme.
In historic Arthur Avenue Retail Market, Bronx Beer Hall offers a selection of local craft beers and food.
Slide off your shoes and sit down on a comfortable pillow at this fine-dining establishment serving Korean-inspired vegetarian cuisine in Manhattan's Koreatown.
Sae Ron is a modern Korean kitchen dedicated to harmoniously blending traditional Korean dishes with contemporary culinary flavors and techniques.
Tasca (Iberian for "tavern") brings together the vibrant flavors and culinary traditions of both Spain and the islands of the Latin Caribbean: Puerto Rico, the Dominican Republic and Cuba.
An intimate global restaurant in Harlem serves impressive cocktails.
Baciccia offers a number of classic Ligurian delicacies, including their neighborhood-famous Trofie al Pesto Genovese, as well as brick oven Roman-style pizza.
Loulou Petit Bistro serves French classics for lunch, brunch and dinner.
Experience the beauty of authentic Italian dining with a menu that specializes in the art of homemade pasta, traditional Italian dishes, delicious risottos, and more.
The Orchard Townhouse is a comfy eatery set in a four-story Chelsea townhouse, offering American plates and twists on classic cocktails.
Back in the prohibition years, Gallaghers Steakhouse served as a speakeasy.
Pera SoHo is an eastern Mediterranean retreat inspired by its namesake Istanbul neighborhood.
Panda Harlem is a unique dining experience inspired by fine cuisine, high-energy hospitality and hip-hop culture.
Atrio Wine Bar & Restaurant serves seasonally-inspired New American cuisine from a dramatic open kitchen.
With ivy growing up the dimly lit columns, funky lighting and throw pillows strewn along several of the seating areas, Barbounia is anything but stuffy.
Recette is a lively French bistro in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, featuring tasty dishes and unique specials by executive chef Alan Vargas.
The specialty at Greenwich Village's Ootoya - Union Square is traditional Japanese home cooking in set-meal style, or teishoku.
Businesspeople flock to this no-frills sushi joint for both lunch and post-work dinners.
Roberto Paciullo's Flatiron District restaurant combines the menu of Paciullo's other Bronx outpost, Roberto's Restaurant, with that of the original Zero Otto Nove.

No Work Allowed is a Japanese izakaya with a northeastern Thai twist—a unique culinary destination where good food, great drinks, and live jazz come together in a relaxed, vintage-inspired atmosphere.
French-Vietnamese cuisine is served in this perennial hot spot.
"Socarrat" is that scrumptious crust that forms at the bottom of the paella pan when the liquid is rendered and the rice has reached its peak of succulence: evidence of a paella cooked to perfection.

Private-stock scotch and nightly jazz performances take center stage at this Flatiron-area lounge, while the dishes served are meant to be enjoyed in their natural state, letting the complexity of their flavors truly take hold.
Amidst a cosmopolitan ambiance inspired by Italy's most fashion-forward city, enjoy elevated, rich Milanese cuisine, iconic drinks like the Negroni, and more.
Rampoldi is an institution and a symbol of Monte Carlo, and this first New York location near Lincoln Center offers the same feel and menu as its original location.
Nudibranch is a Korean-Spanish restaurant that serves thoughtful small plates, juicy wines and cocktails in a chic space in the East Village.
The oldest bar in Queens (and possibly the City), Neir's serves up a simple setting and uncomplicated drinks.
Harta is a New American brasserie that features flavors spanning the Mediterranean and beyond.
La Voglia is an elegant restaurant offering contemporary interpretations of Italian classics on the Upper East Side.
This chic French restaurant in Midtown has a vegetable-forward menu.
Dine at Jean-Georges Vongerichten's celebration of fresh seafood in the Seaport.
Soba Totto serves soba, yakitori and other Japanese specialties just a short walk from Grand Central Terminal.

Boucherie Union Square is a traditional French brasserie and steakhouse, celebrating Joie de Vivre, that prepares a menu of French classics and timeless bistro favorites, in addition to dry-aged steaks.
Jean-Georges Vongerichten's son Cedric leads the kitchen, which blends French, American and Asian influences

Just steps from Lincoln Center, this Upper West Side spot specializes in seafood of all sorts—oyster, clam and shellfish selections that change daily and market-fresh fish available simply grilled a la carte or as composed entrees.
Mission Ceviche, from chef Jose Luis Chavez and partner Brice Mastroluca, has become synonymous with modern Peruvian cuisine, offering a diverse array of dishes crafted from the freshest ingredients.

David Burke Tavern is a modern American tavern on the Upper East Side that features American plates as a reflection of chef Burke’s contemporary approach to cooking, with a nod to elevated New York classics.
Indulge in the art of sharing and enjoy an elevated tapas experience in Tinto Tapas Restaurant & Wine Bar's cozy and inviting space.
Legasea combines a top-tier seafood menu with a fun atmosphere.
Industry Kitchen serves simply prepared modern American dishes with views of the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges and Brooklyn skyline.
Kashkaval Garden offers a casual, relaxed environment in which to enjoy wines, cocktails and Mediterranean food in Hell's Kitchen.
Pink Taco isn’t just another taco joint. What they’re after is a detonation of flavors dancing on your tastebuds.
Café D'Alsace has been an Upper East Side institution for more than two decades, serving Alsatian cuisine in a uniquely special setting.
Gaonnuri's 39th floor penthouse in Koreatown affords wraparound views of Midtown.
This creation of restaurateur Bruno Selimaj (of Bruno Restaurant fame) combines characteristics of a traditional steakhouse with New World modernism in both the menu and decor.
The fourth NYC outpost of this mod-Mexican mini-empire boasts a chic Meatpacking District address (in the prominent space formerly occupied by Vento Trattoria).
Intoxicating Indonesian food from a talented chef in Nolita.
Tel Aviv-inspired restaurant takes inspiration from Bar Lab Hospitality’s founding partner Elad Zvi’s childhood memories of the diverse flavors of Israel.
This bar/restaurant offers a wide variety of cocktails, casual American fare and live music every night after 9pm.
Enjoy the Gallic fare at L'Express 24/7—breakfast, lunch, dinner, brunch, pre-club, post-club, and instead of club.
Ilili is New York's premier contemporary Mediterranean restaurant, offering inspired Lebanese cuisine.
A modern Indian fusion restaurant brings colorful dishes and decor to Gramercy.
At Williamsburg's modern, chic Meadowsweet, executive chef Polo Dobkin has a deft touch with seasonal ingredients, crafting dishes with a Mediterranean bent.
Jing Li is a fine-dining destination in Long Island City, Queens, that serves a mix of Szechuan, Shanghai and Cantonese cuisines.
Located in the heart of West Chelsea, near the Highline, Pastai is a Southern Italian restaurant and bar, serving dishes inspired by their family tradition.
Opto is not your yia-yia's Mediterranean spot, and serves up detail-oriented dishes with no need for puffery.
Hear & There is an listening bar and omakase restaurant in Williamsburg from husband-wife team Howard Ng and Samantha Nie of Third Date Hospitality.
The Long Room is an authentic Irish bar and gastropub located in Times Square.
Chito Gvrito's seasonal menu offers classic Georgian flavors with modern twists using locally sourced ingredients paired with natural Georgian wines and craft cocktails.
Chelsea Ristorante combines the rich tradition of Italian cuisine with casual but elegant design and architecture in an updated and innovative setting.
Reyna is an alluring Mediterranean tapas restaurant and cocktail bar nestled in Union Square.
Inspired by the rich culinary traditions of the Mediterranean, chef John Fraser explores the cuisine of the Aegean at Iris.
Vino &..., the wine bar in the heart of the marketplace at Eataly NYC Downtown, brings the best of Italian wines into one restaurant and bar in downtown New York.
James Beard Award–winning author Serena Bass, Lido's executive chef, creates unique twists on Northern Italian classics on Harlem's "Restaurant Row."
Robert, located atop the Museum of Arts and Design on Columbus Circle, offers an expansive view of Central Park and Broadway.
ABC Kitchen has a design of ethereal lightness, while its sister restaurant, ABC Cocina, is all dark magic.
Rosemary's evokes an enclosed Italian courtyard, full of greenery, reclaimed-wood tables, exposed-brick walls and terra-cotta flooring.
Strip House Midtown brings all the Strip House signatures to a bi-level space on 44th Street that offers lunch, dinner and private dining.
This old-world Mulberry Street gem packs in the garlic lovers nightly, thanks to a gorgeous cocktail lounge and an ultra-romantic garden room.
Experience the gastropub menu at Evalyn’s Tap House, which is thoughtfully curated by their talented chef, Steffen Sander.
Haven is a swanky rooftop lounge and restaurant at the Sanctuary Hotel that offers a welcome retreat from the hectic streets below.
Find 24-hour comfort food and Ukrainian specialties at this East Village standby.
Chef Michele Brogioni translates Armani's tasteful philosophy to include simple yet enticing Italian dishes.
Restorative bowls of ramen, sashimi and sushi rolls are served up at this hip izakaya.
Located at the historic intersection of Christopher and Gay Streets, Petite Boucherie brings a touch of France to the cultured and eclectic neighborhood of the West Village.
This pan-Asian hotspot leaves no stone unturned with its menu, which covers Thai, Chinese and Japanese cuisines.
Morandi's rustic space is a fitting setting for its sublime Italian dishes.
Jacques Brasserie is a romantic bistro that feels like one of those off-the-tourist track places that you always hope to find in Paris.
Tuscan dishes such as the house specialty, cacciucco alla livornese, can be found at this rustic Italian restaurant in Forest Hills.
Beyond the signature gumbo, dining at Filé is an educational feast of the culinary subtleties of Cajun and Creole food.
Curiously nestled behind an enigmatic mural in Midtown, behind a blink-and-you’ll-miss-it door stands Sei Less, an Asian fusion restaurant with an exclusive flair.
Gair is Dumbo’s premier destination for elevated, distinctive cocktails, locally-sourced, seasonally-inspired dishes, and an unmatched environment.
The Belgian-Brazilian couple behind Mojo Mousse Bar brings this Brazilian-inspired cocktail bar to El Barrio.
Three chefs have collaborated to create an elevated neighborhood dining experience at this Upper East Side seasonal New American restaurant.
Setting a standard in authentic Mexican cooking since opening its doors, Rosa Mexicano now has three locations throughout NYC.
Opened in 1963, Restaurant Nippon became the first Japanese restaurant in the United States with an authentic sushi bar.
Devoted and passionate Michelin-recognized chef Maia Acquaviva, the co-founder of Oda House, immerses guests into the flavorful world of traditional Georgian dishes.
Alice is a sophisticated, intimate Italian seafood and lobster bar set in the basement of a historic brownstone.
Sleek and dimly lit Yakiniku Futago specializes in Japanese barbecue.
Wagamama first opened in London in April of 1992 with a clear purpose: to feed guests fresh and nourishing Asian food inspired by the flavors of Japan.
Calle Dão pays homage to Havana’s once-thriving El Barrio Chino (Chinatown), once the largest such community in Latin America.
There are quite a few venerable steakhouses in Midtown, but Morton's stands tall among them.
The Cull & Pistol Oyster Bar is a Michelin-acclaimed seafood restaurant located in Chelsea Market.
This sister restaurant to West Village mainstay Rosemary’s is an all-day Italian café-bar serving wholesome Italian fare in a casual and sophisticated setting.
Located in a historic enclave, Tudor City Steakhouse is a "next generation" steakhouse, offering dishes not typically associated with the genre.
The New American cuisine at Cebu Bar & Bistro includes roast chicken, burgers and risotto balls with porcini mushroom.
DiWine is a wine bar and New American restaurant focused on natural biodynamic wines and hand-crafted cocktails in a relaxed atmosphere.
With a diverse menu featuring traditional Greek eats with a modern approach, guests can indulge in live, wood-fire cooked meats and fish and small plates prepared with the utmost care.
The Upper West Side welcomes a modern split-level Greek restaurant.
Hearth is everything its name implies...a warm, comfortable restaurant with hospitality as its goal.
Pomp & Circumstance is a cozy Mediterranean restaurant with sidewalk seating.
Offering high quality food in luxurious environments, Benjamin Prime melds together classic steakhouse fare and fresh and vibrant seafood with the grill as the main focus.
With its cozy 1920s French look, Excuse My French is a small slip-down-the-basement bistro that feels like a speakeasy but offers much more.
Sweet Catch is an ode to the connection between African-American people and their rich history of seafood culinary mastery.
Tucked away above iPic Theaters is this spirited drinking and dining den with an urban chic atmosphere.

From their handcrafted pastries every morning, to their fresh pastas and locally and seasonally inspired Italian plates at night, Tarallucci e Vino invites you to start or end your day and unwind with them.
As continually mobbed as the Beatles at Shea, the Hard Rock Café is an ongoing international phenomenon.
About as old-school Italian as it gets, the legendary family-style Southern Italian Carmine's delivers everything but the red-checkered tablecloth.
Il Florista is a restaurant, bar, café, florist, boutique, and community education space that embraces the manifold uses and beautiful benefits of flowers.
Chef Alex Tubero's updated Mediterranean menu features house-made pasta, sustainably caught seafood, seasonal produce and meat from family farms.
This clubby Financial District spot serves steakhouse classics and Asian dishes in an airy industrial space.

Boasting an Italian-centric wine list of over 300 distinct selections to match with the menu overseen by executive chef Kristin Sollenne, the restaurant brings a contemporary, farm-to-table approach to Italian dining.
This award-winning restaurant and lounge from renowned restaurateur Cameron Mitchell is designed to please all palates.
Located in Manhattan's Midtown East, Veerays is NYC’s first Indian speakeasy restaurant, envisioned by Michelin-starred chef Hemant Mathur.
Tavola is an authentic Italian restaurant focused on Sicilian, Apulian and Roman cuisine, specializing in wood-fired pizzas, Italian pastas, seafood and other traditional Italian dishes

A cozy Bowery space with two bars for dining and drinking, Bar Primi is a casual corner pasta shop devoted to primi piatti (the pasta course), a staple in chef and co-owner Andrew Carmellini's repertoire.
Kyma's whitewashed interior, decorated with Greek pottery and ceramics, echoes the style of a restaurant in Santorini.
Occupying the historic Limelight space, this elegant Flatiron restaurant serves Asian food with modern touches.
Find Stout NYC Grand Central in the midst of New York City icons including the Chrysler Building and the New York Public Library.
This family-owned restaurant presents an upscale Italian cuisine with artisanal homemade pizzas and gourmet desserts.
Pickles are more than just a garnish at this Southern-inspired eatery; they're a way of life.
The folks at Il Nonno, an Italian restaurant in Astoria, Queens, are passionate about creating a memorable dining experience for every guest.
Nestled in the heart of Lower Manhattan, located in the World Trade Center, Morton's The Steakhouse is a true blend of classic cuisine and contemporary style.
Pan-Asian restaurant with large menu and ornate décor.
The cuisine falls somewhere between French, Italian, and, as the chef loves to insist, “Californian”—reflecting the myriad possible directions of a set menu that changes every week.
Enjoy pure, original, unfiltered Thai food on Manhattan's Upper East Side at Tha Phraya.
BLT Prime’s Upper East Side location has an expanded menu featuring signature standouts such as a selection of USDA Prime and 100% naturally raised Black Angus.
Inspired by his family and their home-cooked meals, Vallata is celebrity chef Tom Colicchio's first-ever Italian restaurant.
Dear Strangers is a Latin-inspired Modern American restaurant and cocktail bar located in Greenwich Village.
Shortly after the original Sant Ambroeus opened its doors in Milan in 1936, a devoted following emerged.
Experience the beauty of authentic Italian dining with a menu that specializes in the art of homemade pasta, traditional Italian dishes, delicious risottos, and more.
Nar Restaurant serves reimagined regional Turkish cuisine, sourced to be clean, organic, and halal-certified.

Socarrat Paella Bar Chelsea reflects an ambiance rich in warmth, comfort and hospitality, and brings out the Spaniard in New York: it's elegant, bold and sexy. A neighborhood staple comprised primarily of one large communal table with a bar and smaller communal tables scattered throughout, Socarrat Chelsea also has a private dining room that can can accommodate up to 28 people.
This hip, Italian-inspired restaurant in a historic brownstone building in the West Village features authentic wood-fired pizza, fresh pasta, plates, craft cocktails and more.

The Library, named for the building's original use as the Astor Library, is a central element of the mezzanine level of this landmark edifice at Astor Place (which famously houses downtown performance venue The Public Theater).
This traditional French restaurant is located in the heart of the Theatre District and has been operated since 1984 by the Denamiel family.
Manuela is a welcoming neighborhood restaurant and bar in SoHo where great contemporary art and food combine to create a convivial atmosphere and sense of abundance.
Fushimi is a buzzing eatery and lounge in Hell's Kitchen near Times Square.

Dine amidst the abundant greenery at The Terrace Restaurant, a casual, all-day eatery inspired by the French brasseries and American chophouses chef and restaurateur John Fraser worked at early in his career.
Try innovative Mexican fare in Prospect Heights.
Tuome is a critically acclaimed East Village restaurant by chef/owner Thomas Chen, whose ingredient-driven contemporary American menu showcases his classic culinary training with Asian influences.
Find old-school glamour and new-school cocktails at this rooftop bar.
Hidden behind a functioning pawn shop, Beauty & Essex is a true gem on the Lower East Side and widely regarded as one of New York's most beautiful restaurants.
At Sarabeth's Central Park South, you'll find contemporary American food, a warm atmosphere and the friendly service Sarabeth's restaurants are known for.
With spectacular views of Times Square and sophisticated and comfortable décor, this lounge is perfect for cocktails or pre-theater snacks above Times Square.
Try well-crafted Mediterranean tapas at this East Village restaurant.
This modern neighborhood brasserie offers an all-day menu of much-loved classics and fresh, seasonal dishes filled with flavors and ingredients from around the world.
The House of the Red Pearl is a clandestine fine dining restaurant.
A meal at this high-end Midtown eatery is sure to put you in a sunny mood.
Obao bridges the gap between the streets of Southeast Asia and the culinary sensibilities of NYC, bringing diners a combination of Thai and Vietnamese comfort foods that have a twist.
La Pecora Bianca Midtown offers an expanded menu from Mario Batali alum Cruz Goler in a bright, sophisticated space nearly twice the size of the original in NoMad.
The concept at Kru is the modern interpretation of 100-year-old Thai recipes.
Burger & Lobster has been serving the finest of burgers and the freshest of lobsters since 2014.
With some serious steaks and chops, this welcoming and unpretentious spot has quite the history as a real Prohibition-era speakeasy.
Blue Mezze Bar - UES is a unique Mediterranean restaurant/bar on Manhattan's Upper East Side with an extensive mezze and cocktail menu, ideal for sharing and tasting.
This Japanese eatery serves ramen, sushi, teriyaki, pork buns and more on its extensive menu.
This casual, family-friendly restaurant on the Manhattan waterfront features shareable dishes such as artichoke and spinach dip and a quartet of mac-n-cheese cones.
Longo Bros. bar-restaurant offers an all-day menu of Italian favorites like antipasti, pasta and pizza.
This opulent restaurant has been a treasured destination since 1927, serving continental classics in a soaring setting.
Docks Oyster Bar has been serving the freshest seafood and oysters for more than 25 years in Midtown Manhattan.
The classic NYC steakhouse, in business since 1837, is where eggs Benedict and baked Alaska were said to be invented.
La Baraka is a Little Neck destination for the best French dining experience...with a touch of North Africa.
Limani, the Greek and Mediterranean restaurant in Rockefeller Center, uses only the highest-quality local and Mediterranean seafood.
Chili specialize in authentic Szechuan cuisine, offering a fiery feast for the senses with traditional dishes like spicy dan dan noodles, mouthwatering mapo tofu, and sizzling dry pots.
With decor that evokes a luxury yacht, Lure puts a contemporary spin on its classic fish-house menu.
In business since 1907 in the Historic Coney Island Amusement Area, Gargiulo's serves classic Neapolitan cuisine.
Churrascaria Plataforma Brazilian Steakhouse is a rodízio-style restaurant.
Andrew Carmellini's Soho spot serves New American fare with an emphasis on local, seasonal produce and comfort food.
This gem of a bistro serves innovative interpretations of classic Greek and Turkish dishes in Murray Hill.
For more than 50 years in Brooklyn Heights, Henry’s End has offered classic staples and neighborhood favorites alongside a seasonally oriented program of specials.
Miss Lily’s 7A, the beloved Caribbean hotspot in the East Village, embodies the best elements of the original with delicious island cooking, friendly staff, a sunny vibe and Caribbean flavor.
Enjoy traditional dishes like homemade crab cakes, chicken wings, lobster tails and a variety of steaks and hearty fare.
Rowland's Bar & Grill serves American gastropub cuisine in a comfortable, modern atmosphere on the lower level at Macy's Herald Square.
Sushi Lab Rooftop is a New York City–born innovative concept with unique creations based on traditional sushi.
Travelers Poets & Friends captures the essence of the Italian coastline with its authentic offerings.
Perhaps the best way to sample dishes from one of world-famous chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten's menus without breaking the bank is by dining at Nougatine, an overlooked gem on the Upper West Side.
The Langham, New York, Fifth Avenue’s signature restaurant celebrates cuisine from the Italian and French Riviera.
Koi New York's chic and sexy surroundings, inventive cocktails and beloved signature dishes set the scene for a fun and sophisticated dining experience.
Nusr-Et is an internationally acclaimed destination for luxury dining from Nusret "Salt Bae" Gökçeis, a Turkish butcher, chef, and restaurateur whose technique became an internet meme.

Jiang Nan - Long Island City serves indulgent and comforting dining experiences, featuring the best of fusion flavors from each region of China, plus high-quality food and ingredients and superior customer service.
The Ivory Peacock offers distinct, imaginative cocktails complemented by a variety of vibrant shareable plates.
Dine on pristine seafood at this upscale Greek restaurant.
An indoor-outdoor, California-style restaurant that has views of the Brooklyn Bridge from Pier 17.
The menu at Dagon, named for the Phoenician and Philistine god of agriculture and the earth, showcases modern Israeli cuisine with Levantine influences.
This walk-in restaurant in Peter Cooper Village brings Rosemary's warm design, accessible menu of seasonal Italian dishes and neighborly hospitality to Manhattan's east side.
The Ribbon—Upper West Side presents spit roasted meats, seafood and Blue Ribbon Restaurants classics in polished surrounds with rustic touches, plus an extensive bar and whisky program.
This cozy, Korean-American family-owned restaurant offers a diverse selection of beef, veggie, seafood, and chicken burgers, each served with a side of crispy fries, pepperoncini, and pickles.
This longstanding Italian restaurant—on the Upper West Side since 1983—serves Tuscan cuisine.
This inviting neighborhood wine bar serves dozens of red, white and sparkling wines by the glass and bottle.

An exquisite menu by chef Marco Barbisotti, a native of Milan, reflects the brand's culinary vision and historic origins of Northern Italy, including its signature vitello tonnato, cotoletta milanese and risotti.
Chef Richard Sandoval’s modern Mexican restaurant evokes the essence of Acapulco, from its decor to its cuisine.
Park Slope, Brooklyn, has quickly risen to New York restaurant fame, and this neighborhood hotspot is no exception.
Meat lovers will love Palermo Argentinian Bistro on Restaurant Row, where beef reigns supreme.
Dos Caminos Times Square spans two floors and features a 40-seat mezcal and margarita bar on the street level and a guacamole bar on the subterranean level.
Metropolis is a vibrant contemporary American restaurant from Marcus Samuelsson within the Perelman Performing Arts Center in Lower Manhattan.
Family-style Thai seafood and great cocktails in NoHo.
Ma•dé draws inspiration from the sandy beaches of Bali for both its menu and décor.
Masseria means farmhouse in Italian, and this restaurant’s inspiration is evident in the stone walls and exposed wooden beams.
Founded by Antonin Brune, Pardon My French is a contemporary version of a bistro style restaurant, offering a modern approach to classic French fare with an elegant twist.
Del Frisco’s features a steakhouse-style menu, with classic starters like a wedge salad and choice cuts of broiled steaks.
This newly renovated subterranean dining space offers a family-style menu that emphasizes traditional Beijing cuisine with an elevated twist.
Bocca Di Bacco is an Italian restaurant located near the Theatre District that is popular with celebrities, tourists and native New Yorkers.
La Pulperia, modeled after the general stores found throughout South America, features rustic Latin cuisine with European influences.
The menu by chef Iacopo Falai reflects the brand’s culinary vision and historic origins of Northern Italy, including its signature vitello tonnato, cotoletta milanese and risotti.
Set inside the iconic New-York Historical Society building across from Central Park, Clara offers upscale New York classics.
Mamo brings a long tradition of Italian hospitality and provençal charm to New York City's SoHo neighborhood.
A modern French restaurant resides inside a posh Soho lifestyle store.
Healthy portions of pork ribs, Texas-style brisket and pulled pork, along with plenty of cocktails and seasonal brews, are on the menu at this barbecue spot.

A culinary venture through Nice in the fall of 2002 inspired partners Simon Oren (Marseille, Sushi Samba and L’Express) and chef Andy d’Amico (Sign of the Dove and Little Dove) to open Nice Matin in 2003.
Mito's esteemed head chef, who has devoted numerous years to the masterful art of cooking, brings with him a wealth of experience at esteemed establishments such as Jean Georges and Buddha Bar.
The Willliamsburg, Brooklyn eatery is the sister restaurant of the well-known Roman dining establishment, which has been run by the same family.
Jean-Georges Vongerichten performs magic with vegetables.
Eataly's seasonal rooftop restaurant will transport you the Italian Alps.
In Thai, "Dagg" means to eat in the warmest, friendliest way possible, just like inviting close friends to enjoy a meal together.
Il Carino’s pride is their delicious, cooked-with-care Italian cuisines, and fine service to meet patrons' needs.
The flagship business launched Danny Meyer’s Union Square Hospitality Group.
The beloved Japanese restaurant Momoya has evolved into this stunning new incarnation on the border of Soho and Nolita.
This dark, clubby restaurant features modern Indian cuisine.
Nostalgia and Palestinian comfort food rule at this casual Chelsea spot.
Psaraki, the creation of longtime hospitality veteran James Paloumbis, evokes the charm of seaside tavernas found along the shores of Greece.
The Dram Shop Bar is a locally owned sports bar and restaurant in Park Slope.
Wonderland holds pride in their captivating presentations of magical cocktail creations paired with Sichuan-inspired tapas.
Under the leadership of executive chef Andy Kitko and his culinary team, Carlotto’s menu honors Italy’s most celebrated regions.
A La Turka is a Turkish restaurant known for its family recipes, lively atmosphere and authentic Mediterranean-style flavors.

This stylish, upscale tapas bar combines Latino fusion small plates and entrees—like sophisticated versions of paella, skirt steak with mashed mangu, sweet plantains with cheese or pulpo al gallego (octopus with potatoes)—with a chic atmosphere.
Tapas bar, wine bar and restaurant filled with delicious wines and dishes inspired by their love of vineyards terroir around the world as well as Mediterranean flavors.
Executive chef Carlos Barroz and his partners in Palermo Argentinian Bistro on Manhattan’s Restaurant Row have opened this second location in Gramercy.
Enjoy the seasonally inspired, seafood-forward, New American cuisine with some of the best waterfront views NYC has to offer.
Aqua Boil is a noteworthy seafood spot serving Cajun-inspired seafood boils, lobster rolls and fried fish platters plus nautically themed cocktails.
Treadwell Park’s craft beer hall offers 20 rotating draft beers and ciders, delivered by on-site "flux capacitor."
The landmark Vanderbilt Hall, once Grand Central Terminal’s main waiting room, has been transformed into Grand Brasserie, a New York City meeting place with Parisian flair.

Open design, light woods and weathered stones conjure the sun-drenched atmosphere of the Greek islands at Ammos, which features upscale authentic Greek cuisine from various regions of Greece, emphasizing seafood and incorporating Mediterranean and North African influences.
Wagamama serves fresh and nourishing Asian food inspired by the flavors of Japan.
Wagamama first opened in London in April of 1992 with a clear purpose: to feed guests fresh and nourishing Asian food inspired by the flavors of Japan.
This classic French brasserie and bar in Tribeca has a friendly attitude and bistro favorites like duck frites. Stay for a meal or have a drink at the welcoming long bar.

Established just across the street from the very first Sarabeth's location, Sarabeth's Upper West Side has been a neighborhood staple serving breakfast, lunch, brunch and dinner seven days a week for nearly 30 years.
Chef Soogil Lim's refined French technique infuses with his Korean heritage for exceptional dishes that stay true to both.
One of NYC's most recognizable restaurants is tucked just inside Central Park. It serves up American fare in an elegant indoor-outdoor setting.
The second in a chain of Palm restaurants, this one is located in the Theatre District.
This opulent gem near Grand Central Terminal is the offspring of Peter Luger alumni Benjamin Prelvukaj and chef Arturo McLeod, who bring with them more than 20 years of experience.
Executive chef/partner Markee Manaloto brings his experience working with Edomae sushi to his new venture, a modern Japanese restaurant in Hudson Square.
This romantic, red-velvet dining room is ideal for late-night, post-show dining with its lively scene and reinterpretations of bistro benchmarks.
Aqua New York has two separate restaurants—Aqua Roma and Aqua Kyoto—each a master of its own cuisine to bring this unique lifestyle dining concept to the table.
Nizza takes its name from the Italian word for the French region of Nice, and its menu is French-Italian fusion.
Since 1992, guests have come to Luigi's in New Hyde Park, Queens, to enjoy a well-made cocktail, a diverse selection of wines and an unforgettable meal.
Empire Steak House's location on the east side has two raised tiers of seating featuring wrap-around booths and a hand-painted dome.
Felice reflects the soul of Italy, inspired by the sophisticated streets of Florence and the rustic warmth of the Tuscan countryside.
Setting a standard in authentic Mexican cooking since opening its doors, Rosa Mexicano now has three locations throughout NYC.
The menu at Baires Grill New York features homemade dishes that capture the rich, traditional flavors of Argentine cuisine.

shortTitle: Tarallucci e Vino - Upper West Side
summary: Tarallucci e Vino Upper West Side is a locals’ favorite restaurant known for expertly crafted coffee, housemade pastries, fresh pastas and authentic Italian cuisine.
Named for the former Astoria Sanitarium that was closed in 1961, Rivercrest offers craft beer, cocktails and all kinds of comfort foods.
Born from Italian tradition and heritage, executive Chef Phillip Basone's menu takes seasonal and local ingredients and places them center stage.
Ootoya's specialty is traditional Japanese home cooking in set-meal style, or teishoku.
Morgan's is Brooklyn through and through, a restaurant with a DIY edge that is as mindful of families with young kids as it is of the borough's bearded whiskey fanatics.
With a dazzling dining gallery, this one-of-a-kind brasserie is built in the tradition of the Belle Epoque, inspired by elegant and ornamental Art Nouveau style.
The experience at The Flatiron Room - Murray Hill is meant to be a theatrical and memorable trip to Old New York.
The towering American Wagyu burger creations and mouth-melting American Wagyu steaks—and the frenzy of sides—speak to the Kings of Kobe core: unadulterated, delicious fun.
An exclusive 21+ venue, BOTA Supper Club is Staten Island’s hottest destination for elevated modern American cuisine, where chic vibes meet sultry sophistication.
Tucci, New York's newest Italian restaurant, serves refined modern Italian cuisine and family recipes in a warm and inviting atmosphere.
A beloved dining destination since 1992, Oceana is renowned for exceptional hospitality, an award-winning wine list, and world-class cuisine.
Catch NYC is a globally influenced seafood restaurant set in a landmark building in Manhattan’s Meatpacking District.
Fast, cheap and friendly, Souvlaki GR exudes the same spirit as its food truck, which began the enterprise.
The goal of this steakhouse is to serve the perfect steak in an environment where everyone, guests and staff, can relax and enjoy themselves.
Felice 56 brings an Italian sensibility to the City through its Tuscan-inspired cuisine.
Chef Palmer adds new twists to his acclaimed cuisine to create the Knickerbocker Hotel's signature "Honest American Cuisine" in an open-action kitchen.
With a small traditional menu, and a warm and inviting dining area, Table d'Hote is ideal for an intimate and delectable meal.
This chic wine bar—overseen by Fabrice Warin, a restaurateur with roots in upmarket New York institutions like François Payard Bakery and Le Cercle Rouge—is an oenophile's dream.
At Oyamel, José Andrés and his team combine Mexico’s rich regional diversity with the vibrant urban atmosphere of Mexico City.

53 introduces an elevated blend of Asian cuisine with a contemporary edge in a chic lifestyle setting, featuring an exciting rotating installation art program in collaboration with Friedrich Petzel Gallery.
Siren is a contemporary European seafood restaurant in South Slope, Brooklyn, specializing in modern dishes and an extensive oyster selection.
From various rolls to teriyaki, and many mouth-watering Japanese dishes, you'll be sure to find many different flavors to try.
This Mexican restaurant is located in a converted house, with a bar on the first floor and restaurant seating on the second level.
Pinky Swear is an art-forward restaurant and cocktail bar on Manhattan's Lower East Side where creativity, connection, and discovery collide.
Gage & Tollner, opened in 1879, is the oldest landmark restaurant in New York, featuring Victorian decor and working gas lamps.
Verde on Smith is Cobble Hill, Brooklyn's neighborhood eatery, featuring regional Italian cuisine complemented by friendly service and warm ambiance.
At Jack & Charlie’s No. 118, nostalgia meets modern flair in a New American menu inspired by mid-century supper clubs.

In the main dining room, Acru offers a tasting menu inspired by global techniques and flavors gleaned from Chef Garwood’s Australian roots and a decade of cooking at some of the world’s top restaurants.
Enjoy casual and rustic Italian waterfront dining in Long Island City.
The newest Stout NYC location is just steps away from Bryant Park, Times Square and the Theatre District.
Taking its name from the port town in southern France, the restaurant, like the town, is a melting pot of influences and ideas.
Nick + Stef's is a masterful blend of ultra-stylish contemporary design and time-honored culinary artistry.
Kimika is an eclectic meeting point of Japanese and Italian comfort foods that merge in a delightful and satisfying way.
Diners feel the tropical breeze and experience yard-man and yard-woman flava style cooking.
Torch & Crown Brewing Company, in Hudson Square, is Manhattan’s only production brewery and restaurant, a thirst-quenching gathering place with a New York-centric food and drinks program.
Set in Times Square—a neighborhood better known for trinkets and fast food chains—Blue Fin is an outlier and a standout.
San Carlo Osteria Piemonte is a corner of Turin in Soho.
An authentic and contemporary Temaki Omakase concept in Flushing, Queens, that highlights delicate hand rolls and artful craft cocktail pairings.
Sereneco is an all-day restaurant in Greenpoint that serves seasonal New American cuisine alongside creative drinks.
Strip House Downtown delivers on dishes and décor, creating a steakhouse unlike any other in New York.
Whether you are a Thai food enthusiast or someone new to the cuisine, Rynn Thai Restaurant & Bar offers the vibrant tapestry of Thai cuisine.
New York has some of the best steaks in the country, and this restaurant on the Upper East Side certainly holds its own.

Bourbon Steak is chef Michael Mina's love letter to the classic American steakhouse, serving the finest cuts of premium beef and seafood, as well as seasonal ingredients sourced from local farmers and purveyors.
Felice on Hudson fits seamlessly into the picturesque West Village, bringing an array of daily specials inspired by seasonal ingredients and an extensive Italian wine list to the neighborhood.
Gyu-Kaku specializes in yakiniku—Japanese barbecue meat over a charcoal grill.
Chef Yuchun Cheung, born and raised in one of Shanghai’s little alleys in a family of chefs and restaurateurs, decided that Little Alley should recreate the Shanghainese cuisine that he grew up with.
Mamazul Mexican Grill, located in NoMad, is a culinary gem that celebrates the vibrant flavors and traditions of Mexico.
Located within The Life Hotel, a landmark of elegance and history, Zoì offers a refined yet welcoming dining experience where tradition meets innovation.
Featuring steakhouse classics, a raw bar, and curated cocktails, The Dynamo Room channels the vibrant spirit of New York’s historic grills.
With an eye on the Mediterranean, chef Michael King and his team craft wood fired pizzas, handmade pastas, and large and small plates to share.
Enjoy the typical approach to Mediterranean flavor with a mix of French and Italian cuisine, with generous portions, based on fresh products and full of sunshine and flavors.
Barlume is an all-day dining experience steeped in the sun-soaked flavors of the Mediterranean.

shortTitle: La Pecora Bianca Upper West Side
summary: La Pecora Bianca Upper West Side offers an expanded menu from Mario Batali alum Cruz Goler in a bright, sophisticated space.

Paris Bar is an iconic French brasserie near Carnegie Hall and Central Park that serves traditional French fare from breakfast through supper every day, with brunch available on weekends, plus a rooftop bar.
A hidden gem inside St. Cloud Rooftop Bar, Akoya offers guests an authentic temaki experience in an intimate and elevated setting atop The Knickerbocker Hotel.
Mastro's collection of sophisticated steakhouses and Ocean Clubs has brought its masterful combination of world-class service, highly acclaimed cuisine and refinement to New York City.
The raison d’être of this cheery basement bistro is to get theater-going patrons fed and out the door by curtain time.
​Experience the flavors of Bangkok at Charoen Krung Thai Restaurant, a Midtown East gem offering authentic Thai cuisine.
The restaurant offers a versatile, rich and colorful cuisine, and strives to represent every corner of Colombia with nature, art, elegance and biodiversity.
Laut presents the best recipes, dishes and flavors from South East Asia, preserving the flavor profiles of each dish while maintaining the integrity of each cuisine.
Pylos brings fresh, wholesome cooking from all regions of Greece to an elegant, contemporary and comfortable setting in the East Village.
Located at Essex Market on the Lower East Side of Manhattan, Dhamaka dives deep into the bold, provincial cooking rarely seen outside of Indian homes and roadside stalls.
Carib-Soul brings bold Caribbean flavors to Prospect Heights, Brooklyn in a casual, welcoming setting.
Felice Columbus brings the vineyards of the Tuscan countryside to the Upper West Side.
At this Greenwich Village location, the intention is to make good wine accessible, affordable and fun.
Naro’s menu focuses on the subtle and delicate flavors of Korean cuisine, drawing inspiration from classic dishes from various moments throughout Korean history.
A modern Japanese restaurant featuring a full a la carte menu grounded in traditional flavors, with a New American twist.
Little Fino is an all day neighborhood bar and cafe located in North Williamsburg that serves a menu of Italian-inspired 'little somethings' alongside a playful cocktail list.
Wayward Fare, a rustic and elegant culinary journey in Prospect Heights, offers a seasonally charged menu that weaves together a tapestry of some lesser-known Mediterranean flavors.

shortTitle: Pig and Khao - Upper West Side
summary: Pig and Khao is inspired by chef Leah Cohen's Filipino heritage and extensive travels throughout Southeast Asia.
Safari, located on a busy block in Harlem, may be the only Somali restaurant in the City.
Catch n' Chop, situated on the Upper East Side, is a chef-driven modern American steakhouse with a focus on sustainable, fresh seafood and raw bar.
Enjoy traditional French cuisine with a touch of Mediterranean flair, beautifully complemented by handcrafted, inspired drinks.
Sotto la luna, located in Astoria, Queens, is an open-kitchen pasta bar and Neapolitan pizzeria that serves modern Italian food in an industrial, high-ceiling, open vibrant space.
Nestled in Battery Park City, Anassa is an elegant interpretation of the traditional Greek taverna.
Cacío e Pepe is an authentic Italian restaurant named for its signature Roman dish—cacío e pepe—homemade pasta theatrically tossed out of a wheel of pecorino cheese.
Nisí Estiatorio is a celebration of Greek culture and cuisine, with a contemporary twist.
The team at Wan Waan, a Thai restaurant in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan, emphasizes feelings through the taste of food.
This dinner and weekend-lunch destination marries New American and Asian-inspired cuisine, emphasizing seasonal ingredients and seafood and vegetable dishes.
You can find popular dishes such as drunken noodle, pad see-ew, and pad thai that are all made with fresh, savory ingredients.
The hearth-driven menu threads the needle through the south of France and Italy, highlighting dishes such as cast iron sfincione (Sicilian pizza), wood-kissed escargot, and dry-aged côte de bôeuf.

Executive chef Cesar Dutan infuses elements of Italian, French and Asian flavors into an inspiring menu of authentic Venetian staples and flavors from across Italy with daring twists and visual flair.
The menu at this East Village restaurant is a celebration of India's culinary treasures—from aromatic curries to flavorful tandoori offerings, all made with the finest spices and ingredients.
Chocolat is a stylish comfort-food restaurant in Harlem that serves updates on Southern classics for brunch, lunch and dinner.
Benihana is a dining experience unlike any other: guests are seated at communal tables in groups, where a personal chef will perform the ancient art of teppanyaki.
Under soaring ceilings and a monumental wire-mesh sculpture by Edoardo Tresoldi, executive chef Jason Hall delivers pure, ingredient-driven flavors.
Pepolino serves authentic Tuscan cuisine in TriBeCa.
Inspired by the golden age of Hollywood studio commissaries, this stylish restaurant is a hidden gem for film lovers and foodies alike.
This Chinese restaurant offers a playful rendition of a classic “cha chaan teng” (a Hong Kong-style cafe or diner) with a downtown fine-dining ambiance.
James Beard Award-winning chef Andrew Carmellini distills his 30-year career into an extraordinary culinary experience that marks his return to fine dining.
Located on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, Conmigo is a modern Mexican restaurant with a bit of New York flair.

Margaux by La Sirène, a celebrated French restaurant offering an authentic and elegant taste of France since 2007, proudly serves timeless classics made with the finest ingredients and traditional techniques.
The Uptown outpost of David Chang’s Korean-American sensation.
8282 is a light-hearted, fresh take on Korean food on the Lower East Side.

shortTitle: La Pecora Bianca Upper East Side
summary: La Pecora Bianca Upper East Side offers an expanded menu from Mario Batali alum Cruz Goler in a bright, sophisticated space.

Enoteca Harlem was born from a journey to the Basque Country, the calmness of the coastal life, the scent of the sea breeze sweeping over the vineyards, and the joy of savoring fresh, local ingredients.
Margaritas and Mexican cuisine meet serious south-of-the-border style at this boisterous, popular mega-eatery.
La Pecora Bianca SoHo offers an expanded menu from Mario Batali alum Cruz Goler in a bright, sophisticated space.
Located inside the Arlo Midtown, Altair serves modern American fare inspired by celestial wonder.
Yefsi Estiatorio, a Greek restaurant on Manhattan's Upper East Side, features an upscale selection of souvlaki, seafood, and Greek Mediterranean cuisine.
Named after the picturesque Greek island known for its rich culture and stunning views, Tinos combines the charm of the Mediterranean with the taste of time-honored recipes.
Romeo's Italian Restaurant offers fine Italian dining in Jackson Heights, Queens.
This tapas bar/restaurant serves dishes with influences of Spain and other Mediterranean countries.
Enjoy guacamole, elevated tacos and plates of chicken mole and barbacoa, and choose from a long list of tequilas, mezcals and seasonal cocktails to accompany your meal.
This restaurant in Columbia University’s neighborhood celebrates the cuisine of France's Loire Valley.
Bringing Mediterranean warmth to Murray Hill at the edge of Kips Bay, Leonetta offers a refined yet inviting dining experience inspired by the coastal flavors of Southern Europe.

Flushing's Guksu Jip serves various noodle dishes,includin special naengmyun (cold noodles with rich toppings), mul naengmyun (cold soup noodle), bibim naengmyun (spicy cold noodle), and hot noodle soup.
Set in a serene, beautiful space with whitewashed arched walls and stonework reminiscent of Cretan Islands, this Upper East Sider focuses on Greek seafood.

Nestled beneath the iconic High Line, Wildflower offers an exceptional fusion of innovative cocktails and contemporary New American cuisine, thoughtfully crafted by the culinary director, chef Edwin Rivera.
Located just a short walk from SoHo and West Village cultural landmarks, Sarabeth’s offers the perfect destination to enjoy both flavor and community in downtown NYC.

shortTitle: Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Elmhurst
summary: The menu includes delectable cuts of grilled meats such as sizzling steaks, lamb, chicken and pork carved tableside by Brazilian trained gaucho chefs as well as a lighter seafood option.
Felice Montague serves classic Italian dishes inspired by the traditional cuisine of the Tuscan countryside.
Atlantis Prime offers a refined surf-and-turf experience near Herald Square in Manhattan, showcasing prime dry-aged steaks, fresh seafood, and expertly crafted sides in an elegant, modern setting.
At Masaaki in Bayside, Queens, find go-to sushi rolls and hibachi, as well as delicately prepared 19-course omakase.
Sojourn Social features a multifaceted venue paired with food and libations representing the melting pot of cultures and cuisines.
Flatiron Steakhouse is a restaurant in Park Slope, Brooklyn, with an old-school neighborhood vibe.

The menu at this Hamilton Heights restaurant features a mix of traditional Caribbean dishes and creative fusion offerings, with standout favorites like jerk chicken, oxtails, and Jamaican beef patties.
Dishes from India’s southernmost coastline get the spotlight at this spot from veteran restaurateur Salil Mehta and Kebab Aur Sharab's Dipesh Shinde.
See No Evil Pizza is a modern New York pizzeria located on the concourse level of the 1 train 50th street subway station.
Le Jardin Bistro stands out with its charming garden-inspired ambiance that makes diners feel as if they’ve been transported straight to France.
Restaurateur Roni Mazumdar and Chintan Pandya explore the yesteryears of India from the perspective of a 75-year-old immigrant man from Kolkata—Roni’s father.
Max's Esca is a premier destination for exceptional dining and fine Italian cuisine on Staten Island.
Acclaimed chef Alex Stupak serves a menu focused on simply prepared seafood using the freshest ingredients from carefully selected purveyors.
Set on Staten Island’s vibrant north shore, Raval Steakhouse is the vision of lifelong friends who have brought their passion for great food and hospitality back to their Staten Island roots.
"La Petite Amélie" is smaller and more intimate than Amélie's other locations, but has the same look and vibe.
Tableside presentations, intricate flavors, and forgotten pleasures mined from the history books are hallmarks of Le B.’s ethos.
La Pecora Bianca Bryant Park offers an expanded menu from Mario Batali alum Cruz Goler in a bright, sophisticated space.
Inspired by the lively neighborhood of Trastevere, Lele’s Roman brings a fresh take on Roman cuisine to Brooklyn's Boerum Hill neighborhood.
Smyth Tavern serves American tavern fare in Tribeca, featuring fresh fish, raw bar, dry-aged steaks, homemade pastas and a specialty burger.

Set in the West Village, The Noortwyck exudes an elegant yet intimate charm, offering a timeless, New American menu that celebrates seasonal dishes, an extensive wine selection and specialty cocktails.
The modern Asian cuisine at Hortus NYC reflects global influences.

shortTitle: Supper Club by Le Petit Parisien
summary: This Upper East Side restaurant is a collaboration between Le Petit Parisien and chef Josh Newman, offering unique seasonal menus.
SEA is a vibrant, fun Southeast Asian restaurant from chef Jungsik Yim, with a raw bar, small plates and shareable plates, along with a smart beverage program.
